item.title: Trevor Ray add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "My soul seemed as foul as smoke from burning cat fur." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Trevor Ray add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I felt after I finished Slaughterhouse-Five that I didn’t have to write at all anymore if I didn’t want to. It was the end of some sort of career. I don’t know why, exactly. I suppose that flowers, when they’re through blooming, have some sort of awareness of some purpose having been served. Flowers didn’t ask to be flowers and I didn’t ask to be me. At the end of Slaughterhouse-Five…I had a shutting-off feeling…that I had done what I was supposed to do and everything was OK ." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Trevor Ray add a quote by Anonymous
Trevor Ray add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "Republicans go to Sam's Club, Democrats go to Costco." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Trevor Ray add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I remember my own childhood vividly … I knew terrible things. But I knew I mustn’t let adults know I knew. It would scare them." -- Anonymous

item.title: Trevor Ray add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I wished my family would buy normal sliced white bread, the kind that went into toasters, like every other family I knew." -- Anonymous

item.title: Trevor Ray add a quote by Chris Grabenstein
item.description: "twenty-four and Sea Haven is, as you might've" -- Chris Grabenstein
